title: P08-1105

sentences.text: Topical blog post retrieval is the task of ranking blog posts with respect to their relevance for a given topic .
To improve topical blog post retrieval we incorporate textual credibility indicators in the retrieval process .

We consider two groups of indicators : post level -LRB- determined using information about individual blog posts only -RRB- and blog level -LRB- determined using information from the underlying blogs -RRB- .
We describe how to estimate these indicators and how to integrate them into a retrieval approach based on language models .
Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set show that both groups of credibility indicators significantly improve retrieval effectiveness ; the best performance is achieved when combining them .

Entity-topical_blog_post_retrieval.label: Topical blog post retrieval
Entity-topical_blog_post_retrieval.description: Topical blog post retrieval is the process of identifying and ranking blog posts based on their relevance to a specific topic or query.

Entity-textual_credibility_indicator.label: textual credibility indicators
Entity-textual_credibility_indicator.description: Textual credibility indicators are metrics used to assess the reliability and trustworthiness of blog posts and blogs, which are integrated into the retrieval process to enhance the ranking of blog posts based on their relevance to a given topic.

Entity-retrieval_approach.label: retrieval approach
Entity-retrieval_approach.description: The 'retrieval approach' refers to a method for ranking blog posts based on their relevance to a given topic, which incorporates textual credibility indicators and is based on language models.

Entity-retrieval_process.label: retrieval process
Entity-retrieval_process.description: The 'retrieval process' refers to the methodology of ranking blog posts based on their relevance to a given topic, enhanced by incorporating textual credibility indicators derived from both individual posts and their underlying blogs.

Entity-blog_level.label: blog level
Entity-blog_level.description: The term 'blog level' refers to a type of credibility indicator used in topical blog post retrieval, which is determined by analyzing information from the underlying blogs rather than individual blog posts.

Entity-two_group_of_indicator.label: two groups of indicators
Entity-two_group_of_indicator.description: The term 'two groups of indicators' refers to the classification of textual credibility indicators used in topical blog post retrieval, specifically distinguishing between 'post level' indicators, which are based on individual blog post information, and 'blog level' indicators, which are derived from the overall information of the blogs themselves.

Entity-ranking_blog_post.label: ranking blog posts
Entity-ranking_blog_post.description: Ranking blog posts refers to the process of evaluating and ordering blog posts based on their relevance to a specific topic, often utilizing various indicators of textual credibility to enhance retrieval effectiveness.

Entity-post_level.label: post level
Entity-post_level.description: The term 'post level' refers to a type of credibility indicator used in topical blog post retrieval that is determined solely by analyzing information from individual blog posts.

Entity-experiment_on_the_trec_blog_track.label: Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set
aliases: Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set
Entity-experiment_on_the_trec_blog_track.description: Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set refer to research conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of incorporating textual credibility indicators in the retrieval of blog posts relevant to specific topics, demonstrating significant improvements in retrieval performance.

mentions.local_name: Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set

Entity-credibility_indicator.label: credibility indicators
Entity-credibility_indicator.description: Credibility indicators are metrics used to assess the trustworthiness of blog posts and blogs, which are integrated into the retrieval process to enhance the relevance ranking of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-indicator.label: indicators
Entity-indicator.description: The term 'indicators' refers to textual credibility metrics used to evaluate the relevance of blog posts in the context of topical blog post retrieval, categorized into post-level indicators based on individual blog post information and blog-level indicators based on information from the entire blog.

Entity-performance.label: performance
Entity-performance.description: The term 'performance' refers to the effectiveness of the retrieval approach in ranking blog posts, specifically measured by the improvement in retrieval effectiveness achieved through the combination of textual credibility indicators.

Entity-combining_them.label: combining them
Entity-combining_them.description: The term 'combining them' refers to the integration of two groups of textual credibility indicators—post level and blog level—into a retrieval approach to enhance the effectiveness of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-topic.label: topic
Entity-topic.description: The term 'topic' refers to the specific subject or theme for which blog posts are ranked in the task of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-the_best_performance.label: the best performance
Entity-the_best_performance.description: The best performance refers to the highest level of retrieval effectiveness achieved in the experiments conducted on the TREC Blog track test set, which is attained by combining both post-level and blog-level textual credibility indicators.

Entity-relevance_for_a_given_topic.label: relevance for a given topic
Entity-relevance_for_a_given_topic.description: The term 'relevance for a given topic' refers to the degree to which blog posts are pertinent or applicable to a specific subject matter in the context of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-trec_blog_track.label: TREC Blog track
Entity-trec_blog_track.description: The TREC Blog track is a research initiative that focuses on evaluating information retrieval techniques using a dataset of blog posts.

Entity-trec_blog_track_test_set.label: TREC Blog track test set
Entity-trec_blog_track_test_set.description: The TREC Blog track test set is a dataset used for evaluating information retrieval systems, specifically designed for blog content within the TREC (Text Retrieval Conference) framework.

Entity-underlying_blog.label: underlying blogs
Entity-underlying_blog.description: Underlying blogs refer to the source blogs from which information is derived to assess the credibility indicators at the blog level in the context of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-individual_blog_post.label: individual blog posts
Entity-individual_blog_post.description: Individual blog posts refer to distinct entries or articles published on a blog, which are evaluated for their relevance and credibility in the context of topical blog post retrieval.

Entity-retrieval_effectiveness.label: retrieval effectiveness
Entity-retrieval_effectiveness.description: Retrieval effectiveness refers to a measure of how well a retrieval system retrieves relevant information in response to user queries, often evaluated through various performance metrics.

Entity-blog_post.label: blog posts
Entity-blog_post.description: Blog posts are written articles or entries published on a website, typically organized in reverse chronological order, that cover various topics and are intended for online readership.

Entity-blog.label: blogs
Entity-blog.description: Blogs are online platforms where individuals or groups regularly publish written content, often in a conversational style, covering a wide range of topics.

Entity-language_model.label: language models
Entity-language_model.description: Language models are computational models designed to understand, generate, and manipulate human language by predicting the probability of sequences of words.

summary: Topical blog post retrieval is the task of ranking blog posts with respect to their relevance for a given topic . To improve topical blog post retrieval we incorporate textual credibility indicators in the retrieval process . We consider two groups of indicators : post level -LRB- determined using information about individual blog posts only -RRB- and blog level -LRB- determined using information from the underlying blogs -RRB- . We describe how to estimate these indicators and how to integrate them into a retrieval approach based on language models . Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set show that both groups of credibility indicators significantly improve retrieval effectiveness ; the best performance is achieved when combining them .

Predicate-is_the_task_of.label: is the task of
Predicate-is_the_task_of.description: The predicate 'is the task of' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a specific activity or process, and the object denotes the goal or purpose that this activity aims to achieve. It indicates that the subject is responsible for carrying out the actions or functions described by the object.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' signifies a relationship where the subject includes or integrates the object as a fundamental component or element within its structure or function. This implies that the subject actively utilizes or embodies the characteristics, features, or aspects represented by the object, thereby enhancing its overall purpose or effectiveness.

Predicate-in_the.label: in the
Predicate-in_the.description: The predicate 'in the' serves to establish a contextual or locational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exists, operates, or is relevant within the framework or domain defined by the object. It implies that the subject is part of, or interacts with, the processes, systems, or environments represented by the object.

Predicate-are_incorporated_in.label: are incorporated in
Predicate-are_incorporated_in.description: The predicate 'are incorporated in' indicates that the subject is included or integrated within the object, suggesting a relationship where the subject contributes to or is a part of the object in a meaningful way.

Predicate-improves.label: improves
Predicate-improves.description: The predicate 'improves' indicates a positive enhancement or advancement in the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object as a result of the influence or contribution of the subject. It suggests that the subject has a beneficial impact on the object, leading to a more favorable state or outcome.

Predicate-consider.label: consider
Predicate-consider.description: The predicate 'consider' indicates a cognitive process in which the subject evaluates, reflects upon, or contemplates the object. It implies a level of thoughtfulness or deliberation regarding the object, suggesting that the subject is taking into account various aspects or implications of the object in question.

Predicate-determined_using_information_a.label: determined using information about
Predicate-determined_using_information_a.description: The predicate 'determined using information about' indicates a relationship where the subject is assessed or established based on specific data or details pertaining to the object. This suggests that the characteristics, status, or classification of the subject are influenced or shaped by the insights derived from the object, highlighting a dependency on the information provided by the object for making determinations regarding the subject.

Predicate-are_considered.label: are considered
Predicate-are_considered.description: The predicate 'are considered' serves to establish a relationship of evaluation or classification between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject is being assessed or viewed in relation to the object, suggesting that the subject is recognized or deemed to possess certain characteristics or qualities associated with the object. This predicate often implies a subjective judgment or consensus regarding the status or nature of the subject in the context of the object.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' serves as a linking verb that connects the subject to the object, indicating a state of being or existence. It establishes an equivalence or relationship between the two, suggesting that the subject is defined or characterized by the object. In this context, 'are' implies that the subject exists in a particular condition or category represented by the object.

Predicate-estimate.label: estimate
Predicate-estimate.description: The predicate 'estimate' signifies a relationship where the subject provides a quantitative or qualitative assessment regarding the object. In this context, the subject evaluates or approximates the characteristics, value, or effectiveness of the object, which can be a method, approach, or any other entity. This relationship implies a process of judgment or calculation based on available data or indicators.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' indicates that the subject is founded upon, derived from, or influenced by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject's characteristics, principles, or methodologies are contingent upon the object, suggesting that the object serves as a foundational element or source of inspiration for the subject.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: The predicate 'show that' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence or demonstrates the validity of the object. It implies that the subject's findings, results, or observations substantiate or confirm the existence, effectiveness, or relevance of the object in question.

Predicate-is_achieved_when.label: is achieved when
Predicate-is_achieved_when.description: The predicate 'is achieved when' indicates a conditional relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject can only be realized or attained through the specific action or process described by the object. It implies that the fulfillment or realization of the subject is contingent upon the occurrence or implementation of the object.

Predicate-enhance.label: enhance
Predicate-enhance.description: The predicate 'enhance' signifies an action or process through which the subject improves, increases, or augments the qualities, effectiveness, or value of the object. In this context, it indicates that the subject contributes positively to the object, leading to a better or more effective state.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider classification represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a larger scope or set of concepts that includes the subject, thereby providing a context in which the subject can be understood as part of a broader framework.
